terms.definition: The CDISC version of the Alzheimer's Disease Assessment Scale-Cognitive (ADAS-Cog CDISC Version) containing 15 summary-level tests. This version is based on combining the total pool of ADAS-Cog tests that were observed during a review of multiple case report forms administered in clinical trials of Alzheimer's disease, as well as the CRF administered in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) observational study. (Modified from Mohs RC, Rosen WG, Davis KL. The Alzheimer's disease assessment scale: an instrument for assessing treatment efficacy. Psychopharmacol Bull 1983;19(3):448-450. Rosen WG, Mohs RC, Davis KL. A new rating scale for Alzheimer's disease. Am J Psychiatry 1984;141(11):1356-1364. Mohs RC, Knopman D, Petersen RC et al. Development of cognitive instruments for use in clinical trials of antidementia drugs: additions to the Alzheimer's Disease Assessment Scale that broaden its scope. The Alzheimer's Disease Cooperative Study. Alzheimer Dis Assoc Disord 1997;11 Suppl 2:S13-S21. Wouters H, van Gool WA, Schmand B, Lindeboom R. Revising the ADAS-cog for a more accurate assessment of cognitive impairment. Alzheimer Dis Assoc Disord 2008;22(3):236-244.).
terms.submissionValue: Questionnaire Category
synonyms: Alzheimer's Disease Assessment Scale-Cognitive CDISC Version Questionnaire

terms.definition: Parkinson's Disease Quality of Life Scale - Changing position causes me to become lightheaded (lying to standing, or sitting to standing).
terms.submissionValue: Parkinson's Disease Quality of Life Test Name

terms.definition: Parkinson's Disease Quality of Life Scale - When walking, I have trouble keeping my balance.
terms.submissionValue: Parkinson's Disease Quality of Life Test Name

terms.definition: Parkinson's Disease Quality of Life Scale - When eating or drinking fluids, I have difficulty swallowing.
terms.submissionValue: Parkinson's Disease Quality of Life Test Name

terms.definition: Parkinson's Disease Quality of Life Scale - My Parkinson's symptoms affect my ability to communicate with people.

codelists.definition: Current Opioid Misuse Measure test name.
codelists.name: Current Opioid Misuse Measure Test Name
codelists.preferredTerm: Current Opioid Misuse Measure Test Name
codelists.submissionValue: Current Opioid Misuse Measure Test Name
synonyms: CDISC Questionnaire COMM Test Name Terminology

terms.definition: Current Opioid Misuse Measure - In the past 30 days, how often have you had trouble with thinking clearly or had memory problems?
terms.submissionValue: Current Opioid Misuse Measure Test Name
synonyms: COMM - Trouble Thinking Clearly or Memory Problems

terms.definition: Current Opioid Misuse Measure - In the past 30 days, how often do people complain that you are not completing necessary tasks? (i.e., doing things that need to be done, such as going to class, work or appointments)
terms.submissionValue: Current Opioid Misuse Measure Test Name

terms.definition: Current Opioid Misuse Measure - In the past 30 days, how often have you had to go to someone other than your prescribing physician to get sufficient pain relief from medications? (i.e., another doctor, the Emergency Room, friends, street source)
terms.submissionValue: Current Opioid Misuse Measure Test Name
synonyms: COMM - Other Sources for Pain Medication

terms.definition: Current Opioid Misuse Measure - In the past 30 days, how often have you taken your medications differently from how they are prescribed?
terms.submissionValue: Current Opioid Misuse Measure Test Name
synonyms: COMM - Taken Medications Other Than Prescribed

terms.definition: Current Opioid Misuse Measure - In the past 30 days, how often have you seriously thought about hurting yourself?
terms.submissionValue: Current Opioid Misuse Measure Test Name
synonyms: COMM - Seriously Thought of Hurting Self

terms.definition: Current Opioid Misuse Measure - In the past 30 days, how much of your time was spent thinking about opioid medications (having enough, taking them, dosing schedule, etc.)?
terms.submissionValue: Current Opioid Misuse Measure Test Name
synonyms: COMM - Time Spent Thinking About Opioids

terms.definition: Current Opioid Misuse Measure - In the past 30 days, how often have you been in an argument?
terms.submissionValue: Current Opioid Misuse Measure Test Name

terms.definition: Current Opioid Misuse Measure - In the past 30 days, how often have you had trouble controlling your anger (e.g., road rage, screaming, etc.)?
terms.submissionValue: Current Opioid Misuse Measure Test Name

terms.definition: Current Opioid Misuse Measure - In the past 30 days, how often have you needed to take pain medications belonging to someone else?
terms.submissionValue: Current Opioid Misuse Measure Test Name
synonyms: COMM - Take Medications Belonging to Others

terms.definition: Current Opioid Misuse Measure - In the past 30 days, how often have you been worried about how you're handling your medications?
terms.submissionValue: Current Opioid Misuse Measure Test Name

terms.definition: Current Opioid Misuse Measure - In the past 30 days, how often have others been worried about how you're handling your medications?
terms.submissionValue: Current Opioid Misuse Measure Test Name
synonyms: COMM - Others Worry About Your Medications

terms.definition: Current Opioid Misuse Measure - In the past 30 days, how often have you had to make an emergency phone call or show up at the clinic without an appointment?
terms.submissionValue: Current Opioid Misuse Measure Test Name
synonyms: COMM - Emergency Phone Call or Clinic Visit

terms.definition: Current Opioid Misuse Measure - In the past 30 days, how often have you gotten angry with people?
terms.submissionValue: Current Opioid Misuse Measure Test Name

terms.definition: Current Opioid Misuse Measure - In the past 30 days, how often have you had to take more of your medication than prescribed?
terms.submissionValue: Current Opioid Misuse Measure Test Name
synonyms: COMM - Take More Medication Than Prescribed

terms.definition: Current Opioid Misuse Measure - In the past 30 days, how often have you borrowed pain medication from someone else?
terms.submissionValue: Current Opioid Misuse Measure Test Name

terms.definition: Current Opioid Misuse Measure - In the past 30 days, how often have you used your pain medicine for symptoms other than for pain (e.g., to help you sleep, improve your mood, or relieve stress)?
terms.preferredTerm: COMM1-Used Pain Meds For Other Symptoms

terms.definition: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale - Facial and Oral Movements, Muscles of facial expression, e.g., movements of forehead, eyebrows, periorbital area, cheeks. Include frowning, blinking, grimacing of upper face.
terms.submissionValue: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale Test Name

terms.definition: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale - Facial and Oral Movements, Lips and perioral area, e.g., puckering, pouting, smacking.

terms.submissionValue: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale Test Name

terms.definition: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale - Facial and Oral Movements, Tongue. Rate only increase in movement both in and out of mouth, not inability to sustain movement.
terms.submissionValue: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale Test Name

terms.definition: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale - Extremity Movements, Upper (arms, wrists, hands, fingers). Include movements that are choreic (rapid, objectively purposeless, irregular, spontaneous) or athetoid (slow, irregular, complex, serpentine). Do not include tremor (repetitive, regular, rhythmic movements).
terms.submissionValue: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale Test Name

terms.definition: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale - Extremity Movements, Lower (legs, knees, ankles, toes), e.g., lateral knee movement, foot tapping, heel dropping, foot squirming, inversion and eversion of foot.
terms.submissionValue: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale Test Name

terms.definition: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale - Trunk Movements, Neck, shoulders, hips, e.g., rocking, twisting, squirming, pelvic gyrations. Include diaphragmatic movements.
terms.submissionValue: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale Test Name

terms.definition: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale - Global Judgments, Severity of abnormal movements, based on the highest single score on the above items.
terms.submissionValue: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale Test Name

terms.definition: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale - Global Judgments, Incapacitation due to abnormal movements.

terms.definition: Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale - Anxious mood: worries, anticipation of the worst, fearful anticipation, irritability.
terms.submissionValue: Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale Test Name

terms.definition: Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale - Tension: feelings of tension, fatigability, startle response, moved to tears easily, trembling, feelings of restlessness, inability to relax.
terms.submissionValue: Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale Test Name

terms.definition: Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale - Fears: of dark, of strangers, of being left alone, of animals, of traffic, of crowds.
terms.submissionValue: Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale Test Name

terms.definition: Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale - Insomnia: difficulty falling asleep, broken sleep, unsatisfying sleep and fatigue on waking, dreams, nightmares, night terrors.
terms.submissionValue: Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale Test Name

terms.definition: Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale - Intellectual: difficulty in concentration, poor memory.
terms.submissionValue: Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale Test Name

terms.definition: Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale - Depressed mood: loss of interest, lack of pleasure in hobbies, depression, early waking, diurnal swing.
terms.submissionValue: Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale Test Name

terms.definition: Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale - Somatic (muscular): pains and aches, twitching, stiffness, myoclonic jerks, grinding of teeth, unsteady voice, increased muscular tone.
terms.submissionValue: Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale Test Name

terms.definition: Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale - Somatic (sensory): tinnitus, blurring of vision, hot and cold flushes, feelings of weakness, pricking sensation.
terms.submissionValue: Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale Test Name

terms.definition: Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale - Cardiovascular symptoms: tachycardia, palpitations, pain in chest, throbbing of vessels, fainting feelings, missing beat.
terms.submissionValue: Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale Test Name

terms.definition: Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale - Respiratory symptoms: pressure or constriction in chest, choking feelings, sighing, dyspnea.
terms.submissionValue: Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale Test Name

terms.definition: Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale - Gastrointestinal symptoms: difficulty swallowing, wind abdominal pain, burning sensations, abdominal fullness, nausea, vomiting, borborygmi, looseness of bowels, loss of weight, constipation.
terms.submissionValue: Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale Test Name

terms.definition: Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale - Genitourinary symptoms: frequency of micturition, urgency of micturition, amenorrhea, menorrhagia, development of frigidity, premature ejaculation, loss of libido, impotence.
terms.submissionValue: Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale Test Name

terms.definition: Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale - Autonomic symptoms: dry mouth, flushing, pallor, tendency to sweat, giddiness, tension, headache, raising of hair.
terms.submissionValue: Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale Test Name

terms.definition: Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale - Behavior at interview: fidgeting, restlessness or pacing, tremor of hands, furrowed brow, strained face, sighing or rapid respiration, facial pallor, swallowing, etc.
terms.submissionValue: Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale Test Name
